entry.dc:title: Multiple template-based image matching using alpha-rooted quaternion phase correlation
entry.dc:creator: DelMarco S.
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
entry.dc:description: In computer vision applications, image matching performed on quality-degraded imagery is difficult due to image content distortion and noise effects. State-of-the art keypoint based matchers, such as SURF and SIFT, work very well on clean imagery. However, performance can degrade significantly in the presence of high noise and clutter levels. Noise and clutter cause the formation of false features which can degrade recognition performance. To address this problem, previously we developed an extension to the classical amplitude and phase correlation forms, which provides improved robustness and tolerance to image geometric misalignments and noise. This extension, called Alpha-Rooted Phase Correlation (ARPC), combines Fourier domain-based alpha-rooting enhancement with classical phase correlation. ARPC provides tunable parameters to control the alpha-rooting enhancement. These parameter values can be optimized to tradeoff between high narrow correlation peaks, and more robust wider, but smaller peaks. Previously, we applied ARPC in the radon transform domain for logo image recognition in the presence of rotational image misalignments. In this paper, we extend ARPC to incorporate quaternion Fourier transforms, thereby creating Alpha-Rooted Quaternion Phase Correlation (ARQPC). We apply ARQPC to the logo image recognition problem. We use ARQPC to perform multiple-reference logo template matching by representing multiple same-class reference templates as quaternion-valued images. We generate recognition performance results on publicly-available logo imagery, and compare recognition results to results generated from standard approaches. We show that small deviations in reference templates of sameclass logos can lead to improved recognition performance using the joint matching inherent in ARQPC. © 2010 Copyright SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering.
entry.authkeywords: Alpha-Rooting | Logo Recognition | Phase Correlation | Quaternion

entry.dc:title: Mobile Multimedia/Image Processing, Security, and Applications 2010
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
entry.dc:description: The proceedings contain 33 papers. The topics discussed include: cell phones as imaging sensors; experimental study on GMM-based speaker recognition; a new approach for sclera vein recognition; multimodal eye recognition; Human action recognition using extreme learning machine via multiple types of features; fusion strategies for boosting cancelable online signature verification; a new approach for cancelable iris recognition; visual words for lip-reading; a novel key management scheme using biometrics; improving the recognition of fingerprint biometric system using enhanced image fusion; eBiometrics: an enhanced multi-biometrics authentication technique for real-time remote applications on mobile devices; multiple template-based image matching using alpha-rooted quaternion phase correlation; and CT baggage image enhancement using a combination of alpha-weighted mean separation and histogram equalization.

entry.dc:title: Novel gray-scale watermarking algorithm based on QFT
entry.dc:creator: Zhao C.
entry.prism:publicationName: 11th International Conference on Control, Automation, Robotics and Vision, ICARCV 2010
entry.dc:description: This paper proposes a novel algorithm of embedding gray-scale watermark image into an RGB host image based on the Quaternion Fourier Transform (QFT). The R, G, B color components are represented respectively by the three imaginary parts of a pure imaginary quaternion and the gray-scale watermark image is inserted into the real part of the carrier image which is transformed by the QFFT. By using the symmetrical characteristic of the real part, we achieve the insertion of the gray-scale watermark image without lose. Experiment results show that the watermarked image with this method has the biggest imperceptibility with the best PSNR when compared with other gray-scale watermarking schemes. ©2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Gray-scale watermark | Imperceptbility | QFT | RGB image

entry.dc:title: Adaptive sensor data fusion in motion capture
entry.dc:creator: Sun S.
entry.prism:publicationName: 13th Conference on Information Fusion, Fusion 2010
entry.dc:description: Micro-sensor human motion capture has shown its potentials because of its ubiquity and low cost. One of the biggest challenges in micro-sensor motion estimation is the drift problem caused by integration of angular rates to obtain orientation. To reduce the drift, existing algorithms make use of gravity and earth magnetic filed measured by accelerometers and magnetometers respectively. Unfortunately, body segment acceleration and environment magnetic disturbance produce strong interferences to the gravity and earth magnetic field measurement respectively. This paper presents a novel sensor fusion algorithm for driftfree orientation estimation, where a quaternion-based complementary Kalman filter is designed. To optimize the performance under interference, this filter fuses gyroscope, accelerometer and magnetometer signals adaptively based on their information confidence, which are evaluated by computing their interference level. The proposed algorithm showed least error compared with the existing methods in the quantitative experiments, and its effectiveness was also verified by the stable and accurate human motion estimation.

affiliation.affilname: University of Chinese Academy of Sciences

entry.authkeywords: Adaptive weighting | Drift | Human motion capture | Kalman filtering | Sensor fusion

entry.dc:title: Quaternion frequency watermarking algorithm for color images
entry.dc:creator: Sun J.
entry.prism:publicationName: 2010 International Conference on Multimedia Technology, ICMT 2010
entry.dc:description: A new method to embed the watermarks in the amplitude of the quaternion is proposed this paper. Firstly, ununiformity of each unit quaternion block in host image is calculated to pick up the potential block adaptively. Secondly, frequency matrix of host color image is obtained by using quaternion Fourier transform. After that, the water marks are embedded into the amplitude of AC coefficient. Experimental results verify the effectiveness and superiority of the proposed algorithm. ©2010 IEEE.

affiliation.affilname: Nanjing University of Information Science & Technology
Nanjing University of Science and Technology

entry.authkeywords: Digital watermarking | Quaternion | Quaternion fourier transform

entry.dc:title: Feature extraction for vibration signal of asynchronous motor based on quaternion K-L transform
entry.dc:creator: Jia T.
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings - International Conference on Electrical and Control Engineering, ICECE 2010
entry.dc:description: This paper proposed a new method of feature extraction for vibration signals of asynchronous motors based on quaternion K-L transform. The vibration signals were detected by the vibration detector with three channels X, Y, Z, that were orthogonal axes. We constructed quaternion sequence based on signals of the three channels, and than the quaternion sequences were transformed by quaternion K-L method to extract features for asynchronous motors with faults. In order to verify it's effectiveness, this method was applied combined with SVM classifier, the experimental results had proved its efficiency and feasibility, and dominated that it could be well applicable for asynchronous motor fault diagnosis. © 2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Asynchronous motor | Feature extraction | K-L transform | Quaternion

entry.dc:title: Color image compression based on quaternion neural network principal component analysis
entry.dc:creator: Luo L.
entry.prism:publicationName: 2010 International Conference on Multimedia Technology, ICMT 2010
entry.dc:description: A color image compression algorithm based on quaternion neural network approach is proposed. The original RGB based color image of Lena can be firstly modeled as pure imaginary quaternion matrix, i.e. any pixel of R,G,B corresponding to the I,J,K imaginary axis , to ensure the integrity of pixel in the computation. The obtained quaternion matrix can be split up into 8X8 sub-blocks and vector quantization to make up of a new sample set. This sample set then is used to train the quaternion neural network adopting quaternion Generalized Hebbian Algorithm (QGHA), acquiring a quaternion weight coefficient that can get the principal components (PCs), the weight can be used to compress and reconstruct the image. Experimental results show the proposed algorithm is effective, the weight trained from image of Lena is successfully used to other images' compression and reconstruction. ©2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Color image compression | Quaternion neural network | Quaternion principle componet anlysis

entry.dc:title: Color pattern recognition using fast quaternion correlation algorithm
entry.dc:creator: Pan J.
entry.prism:publicationName: ISSCAA2010 - 3rd International Symposium on Systems and Control in Aeronautics and Astronautics
entry.dc:description: Quaternion correlation techniques take advantage of high recognition precision and strong noise tolerance have been widely used in mangy application of color image processing. In this paper, a fast color pattern recognition algorithm based on quaternion correlation techniques is proposed. By traditional complex fast Fourier transform , a more efficient quaternion correlation algorithm was applied in the color pattern recognition aim at enhancing the efficiency of available algorithm. Experimental results on synthetic and natural images verify our arguments throughout the paper. ©2010 IEEE.

entry.dc:title: Embedded integrated GPS/MIMU/compass navigation system
entry.dc:creator: Cai T.
entry.prism:publicationName: Yi Qi Yi Biao Xue Bao/Chinese Journal of Scientific Instrument
entry.dc:description: An embedded integrated GPS/MIMU/compass navigation system was developed based on FPGA and DSP. The system hardware consists of quartz MEMS gyroscope, flexible quartz accelerometers, GPS receiver, digital magnetic compass, FPGA, DSP-based high-speed navigation computer modules and etc. The strapdown navigation algorithm, adopting coning correction quaternion calculation and sculling compensation, and extended Kalman filter with 18 state variables, containing sensor noise model, are introduced in the integrated algorithm. Inertial sensors and MIMU navigation information are used to control the quality of GPS and magnetic compass signals. Experimental testing of the integrated system was performed in land vehicle. Results show that the horizontal attitude error is less than 0.2°, head error is not larger than 0.3°, and positioning error is within 3 meters.

affiliation.affilname: Sichuan Institute of Piezoelectric and Acoustooptic Technology
Laboratory of Micro Inertial Instrument and Advanced Navigation Technology

entry.authkeywords: GPS | Integrated navigation system | Magnetic compass | MIMU

entry.dc:title: Rational curves in the three-dimensional sphere
entry.dc:creator: Georgiev G.
entry.prism:publicationName: AIP Conference Proceedings
entry.dc:description: We consider the three-dimensional sphere as a hypersurface embedded in the four-dimensional Euclidean space. The pre-images of polynomial and rational curves in the Euclidean 3-space under stereographic projection form a special class of rational curves on 3-sphere. We investigate these spherical curves in terms of Cartesian coordinates and quaternions. © 2010 American Institute of Physics.
entry.authkeywords: Bézier curves | Quaternion algebra | Three-dimensional sphere

entry.dc:title: PCA based unsupervised change detection for color satellite images under the quaternion model
entry.dc:creator: Luo W.
entry.prism:publicationName: ISPACS 2010 - 2010 International Symposium on Intelligent Signal Processing and Communication Systems, Proceedings
entry.dc:description: In this paper, a new technique is presented for unsupervised change detection in color satellite multi-temporal images. It is accomplished by three stages. First, the color image is modeled into the pure quaternion image. In order to process color image directly, the quaternion mode is introduced, in which the Red, Green and Blue values of each pixel of a color image are represented as single pure quaternion valued pixel. And a color image can be represented as a pure quaternion image. Second, a computationally simple method for singular value decomposition (SVD) is adopted to perform principle component analysis (PCA) on the pure quaternion image. Finally, change detection in a pair of color satellite images can be achieved Experimental results show the superior of the proposed method over the state-of-the-art methods for change detection. © 2010 IEEE.

affiliation.affilname: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China

entry.dc:title: Discrete-quaternion-fourier-transform-based registration method for color images
entry.dc:creator: Yang C.
entry.prism:publicationName: ICALIP 2010 - 2010 International Conference on Audio, Language and Image Processing, Proceedings
entry.dc:description: The descriptive capability of color images for a scene is better than that of grayscale images. Traditional registration methods to register color images convert them to grayscale ones, in which the registration precision is decreased due to the loss of color information. By extending some properties of the discrete Fourier transform to the quaternion domain, a discrete-quaternion- Fourier-transform-based registration method for color images is proposed in this paper. Color images are represented in quaternion form, and the parameters in the rotation-scale-translation model are recovered using the rotation and the scale properties of DQFT and the quaternion phase correlation. Finally the color images are registered through image translation using the recovered parameters. The method proposed in this paper, in which color images are processed holistically, achieved high registration precision. ©2010 IEEE.

entry.dc:title: An approach for compressing of multichannel vibration signals of induction machines based on quaternion cosine transform
entry.dc:creator: Jia T.
entry.prism:publicationName: 2010 International Conference on E-Product E-Service and E-Entertainment, ICEEE2010
entry.dc:description: A method of multichannel vibration data compression for induction machines based on quaternion discrete cosine transform (QDCT) were proposed in this paper. The three axis X,Y and Z vibration data were obtained by the multichannel sensor which placed On the testing point of the induction machine, X,Y and Z vibration data were constructed an pure quaternion sequence and was analyzed and compressed by QDCT, the low frequency components was gotten and to be the compression date. The experiment indicated that this method possessed well reconstruction and real-time, and provided a new method to data compression and feature extraction for multichannel vibration signal of induction machines. ©2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Data compression | Induction machine | Multichannel vibration signals | Quaternion cosine transform

entry.dc:title: Adaptive extended Kalman filtering algorithm for SINS/GPS integrated navigation in guided munitions
entry.dc:creator: Li B.
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings - 2010 IEEE International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Intelligent Systems, ICIS 2010
entry.dc:description: The Integrated Navigation Kalman Filter of Strap down Inertial Navigation System/Global Positioning System (SINS/GPS) with pesudorange and quaternion as observation information, has been researched for space autonomous navigation. To improve the real-time working performance, an improved Adaptive Extended Kalman filtering algorithm (AEKF) is proposed here to estimate the measurement noise on-line for the SINS/GPS integrated navigation systems. The measurement remnant chi-square method is used to automatically adjust the sliding window basing on the innovation sequence. The experiment result shows that this new approach could improve the accuracy of the integrated navigation system effectively when the measurement noise is unknown. Compared to the original algorithm in longitude, latitude, altitude and velocity, the orientation precision is improved greatly. ©2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Adaptive extended kalman filteringr | Information fusion | Integraion navigation system

entry.dc:title: Preprocessing methods for SVD-based iris recognition
entry.dc:creator: Gajdoš P.
entry.prism:publicationName: 2010 International Conference on Computer Information Systems and Industrial Management Applications, CISIM 2010
entry.dc:description: In this paper, we compare the performance of singular value decomposition for the recognition of human irises after image preprocessing by quaternion transformation and colour levelling based on contour detection. The results are also compared with our previous approach based on classic iris unfolding. ©2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Contours | Information retrieval | Iris recognition | Quaternion | SVD

entry.dc:title: Clifford-fourier transform for color image processing
entry.dc:creator: Batard T.
entry.prism:publicationName: Geometric Algebra Computing: in Engineering and Computer Science
entry.dc:description: The aim of this paper is to define a Clifford-Fourier transform that is suitable for color image spectral analysis. There have been many attempts to define such a transformation using quaternions or Clifford algebras. We focus here on a geometric approach using group actions. The idea is to generalize the usual definition based on the characters of abelian groups by considering group morphisms from 2 to spinor groups Spin(3) and Spin(4). The transformation we propose is parameterized by a bivector and a quadratic form, the choice of which is related to the application to be treated. A general definition for 4D signal defined on the plane is also given; for particular choices of spinors, it coincides with the definitions of S. Sangwine and T. Bülow. © 2010 Springer-Verlag London Limited.

entry.dc:title: 2010 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing, ICIP 2010 - Proceedings
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings - International Conference on Image Processing, ICIP
entry.dc:description: The proceedings contain 1151 papers. The topics discussed include: two-level optimized tone mapping for high dynamic range images; a practical algorithm for tanner graph based image interpolation; fast geometric re-ranking for image-based retrieval; efficient feature selection for polyp detection; image retrieval on the honeycomb image browser; video object inpainting using manifold-based action prediction; hue-based quaternionic criterion for focused-color extraction; on geometric and soft shape content-based search; a novel method of fingerprint minutiae extraction based on Gabor phase; a comparative study on quality assessment of high resolution fingerprint images; PCTV: a biologically- and psychologically-inspired edge and line detection; 3D face recovery from intensities of general and unknown lighting using partial least squares; photo-consistent surfaces from a sparse set of viewpoints; view synthesis based on conditional random fields and graph cuts; and super resolution image reconstruction using total variation regularization and learning-based method.

entry.dc:title: An adaptive fast quaternion-based human motion tracking algorithm with Inertial/Magnetic technology
entry.dc:creator: Mi P.
entry.prism:publicationName: International Conference on Signal Processing Proceedings, ICSP
entry.dc:description: Real-Time human motion tracking with Inertial/Magnetic sensors is a key technology in human-computer interaction applications. A computationally efficient and robust algorithm for estimating orientation is critical. This paper gives a quaternion-based orientation tracking algorithm for human motion tracking with a triaxial angular rate sensor, a triaxial accelerometer, and a triaxial magnetometer. The algorithm utilizes the Gauss-Newton method for parameter optimization in conjunction with our adaptive filter. Based on the use of the Gauss-Newton method, particularly the reduced-order implementation, this paper presents a method to avoid computing matrix inverse compared to the conventional G-N method to decrease the computing time. In addition, considering the effects of ferromagnetic magnetic disturbances and body motions acceleration, the paper proposes an adaptive filter to accommodate the disturbance situation. Real-time implementation and testing results of the quaternion-based algorithm are presented. Experimental results validate the algorithm and show the robustness and efficiency for human motion tracking. © 2010 IEEE.

affiliation.affilname: Institute of Automation Chinese Academy of Sciences

entry.authkeywords: Adaptive filter | Gauss-Neton | Human motion tracking | Inertia and magnetic sensor | Orientation | Quaternion

entry.dc:title: A new color image blind watermarking algorithm based on quaternion
entry.dc:creator: Li Y.
entry.prism:publicationName: International Conference on Signal Processing Proceedings, ICSP
entry.dc:description: In this paper, a new color image blind watermarking technology which uses the properties of the quaternion matrix is proposed. The image is represented in the form of quaternion matrix. Then many important properties of quaternion matrix singular value decomposition are discussed with several experiments to find the best field to embed the watermarking information. Fortunately, the field of QSVD transformation is very feasible to carry the watermark information. Then a blind watermarking algorithm which uses the conjugate and rotation to embed the watermarking information into the field of QSVD transformation is depicted. The experimental results indicate that the algorithm has good performance under many attacks. © 2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Blind watermark | Quaternion | Quaternion matrix singular value decomposition

entry.dc:title: Video retargeting with nonlinear spatial-temporal saliency fusion
entry.dc:creator: Lu T.
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings - International Conference on Image Processing, ICIP
entry.dc:description: Video retargeting (resolution adaptation) is a challenging problem for its highly subjective nature. In this paper, a nonlinear saliency fusing approach, that considers human perceptual characteristics for automatic video retargeting, is being proposed. First, we incorporate features from phase spectrum of quaternion Fourier Transform (PQFT) in spatial domain and global motion residual based on matched feature points by the Kanade-Lucas-Tomasi (KLT) tracker in temporal domain. In addition, under a cropping-and-scaling retargeting framework, we propose content-aware information loss metrics and a hierarchical search to find optimal cropping window parameters. Results show the success of our approach on detecting saliency regions and retargeting on images and videos. © 2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: KLT | Nonlinear | QPFT | Saliency | Video retargeting

entry.dc:title: Hue-based quaternionic criterion for focused-color extraction
entry.dc:creator: Petit F.
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings - International Conference on Image Processing, ICIP
entry.dc:description: In this paper, a method of specific colored area extraction into a color image is presented. Usual color segmentation or edge detection operators perform a global processing on the image. Thus, every area into an image is detected. The whole image is subdivided into several region by labeled pixels, or boundaries in case of an edge detection. Our purpose is to extract only specific areas into an image sharing a specific color attribute, hence sharing a common color based on a specific hue. The quaternionic geometrical transformation into RGB color space is used. A specific hue axis is defined. From this axis, a criterion defines a color subspace into an RGB color space using the quaternionic HSI interpretation of RGB vectors. © 2010 IEEE.
entry.authkeywords: Color extraction | Color images | Color subspace | Edge detection | Quaternions

entry.dc:title: Structural analyse of the genetic code using p-adics numbers and Hadamard matrices
entry.dc:creator: Jiao S.
entry.prism:publicationName: International Conference on Signal Processing Proceedings, ICSP
entry.dc:description: There are more of 64! possibilities of representation of the genetic code via a 8X8 square matrix. All these representations are not equivalent and some have specific properties .In particular, the representation of the standard code, mostly used, brings into focus the role of the first two bases in the 64 codons that correspond to the 20 amino acids. The distance between codons and the regrouping of synonymous codons are well integrated in this quasi universal formulation. But other approaches have been developed recently, especially from the p-adic numbers system and Hadamard matrices. It is interesting, not only to compare these different formulations, but also seek to involve them in a synthesis approaches in order to benefit from all their properties. © 2010 IEEE.

entry.dc:title: Upper limb portable motion analysis system based on inertial technology for neurorehabilitation purposes
entry.dc:creator: Pérez R.
entry.prism:publicationName: Sensors
entry.dc:description: Here an inertial sensor-based monitoring system for measuring and analyzing upper limb movements is presented. The final goal is the integration of this motion-tracking device within a portable rehabilitation system for brain injury patients. A set of four inertial sensors mounted on a special garment worn by the patient provides the quaternions representing the patient upper limb's orientation in space. A kinematic model is built to estimate 3D upper limb motion for accurate therapeutic evaluation. The human upper limb is represented as a kinematic chain of rigid bodies with three joints and six degrees of freedom. Validation of the system has been performed by co-registration of movements with a commercial optoelectronic tracking system. Successful results are shown that exhibit a high correlation among signals provided by both devices and obtained at the Institut Guttmann Neurorehabilitation Hospital. © 2010 by the authors.
entry.authkeywords: Biomechanical model | Inertial sensors | Motion tracking | Neurorehabilitation | Upper limb

entry.dc:title: Color edge detection using multiscale quaternion convolution
entry.dc:creator: Xu J.
entry.prism:publicationName: International Journal of Imaging Systems and Technology
entry.dc:description: This article presents a novel color edge detection algorithm based on quaternion convolution. A set of multiscale quaternion masks are presented, and the filtered results are multiplied at adjacent scales using dot product to enhance the edge structures while diluting noise. Experimental results show that the proposed method is efficient and robust for color images. © 2010 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.

affiliation.affilname: Southwestern University of Finance and Economics
University of Electronic Science and Technology of China

entry.authkeywords: color image | dot product | edge detection | multiscale | quaternion convolution

entry.dc:title: Thermal condition monitoring system using log-polar mapping, quaternion correlation and max-product fuzzy neural network classification
entry.dc:creator: Wong W.K.
entry.prism:publicationName: Neurocomputing
entry.dc:description: Nowadays, most factories rely on machines to help boost up their production and process. Therefore, an effective machine condition monitoring system plays an important role in these factories to ensure that their production and process are running smoothly all the time. In this paper, a new and effective machine condition monitoring system using log-polar mapper, quaternion based thermal image correlator and max-product fuzzy neural network classifier is proposed. Two classification characteristics, namely peak to sidelobe ratio (PSR) and real to complex ratio of the discrete quaternion correlation output (p-value) are applied in this proposed machine condition monitoring system. Large PSR and p-value showed a good match among correlation of the input thermal image with a particular reference image, but reversely for small PSR and p-value match. In the simulation, log-polar mapping is found to have solved the rotation and scaling invariant problems in quaternion based thermal image correlation. Besides, log-polar mapping can possess two fold data compression capability. Log-polar mapping helps smoothen up the output correlation plane, hence making better measurement for PSR and p-values. The simulation results have also proven that the proposed system is an efficient machine condition monitoring system with an accuracy of more than 94%. © 2010 Elsevier B.V.
entry.authkeywords: Log-polar mapping | Max-product fuzzy neural network | Quaternion correlation | Thermal condition monitoring system | Thermal imaging
